name: Life Changing Instant Pot Beef Stew
description: Beef Stew made in an Instant Pot! 6 ingredients, 45 minutes, SO EASY. The perfect, comforting meal for all those chilly fall and winter days.

recipe_ingredient.note: 2 lbs. beef, chuck roast, fat trimmed, cut into 1-2-inch chunks
recipe_ingredient.display: 2 lbs. beef, chuck roast, fat trimmed, cut into 1-2-inch chunks

recipe_ingredient.note: 2 stalks celery, sliced diagonally in thick pieces
recipe_ingredient.display: 2 stalks celery, sliced diagonally in thick pieces

recipe_ingredient.note: 6 carrots, sliced diagonally in thick pieces
recipe_ingredient.display: 6 carrots, sliced diagonally in thick pieces

recipe_ingredient.note: 2 tablespoons small tapioca (affiliate link)- see notes
recipe_ingredient.display: 2 tablespoons small tapioca (affiliate link)- see notes

recipe_instructions.text: Place everything in the Instant Pot. Select the stew/meat setting (about 35 minutes, high pressure). After it’s done, let everything mellow out for about 10 minutes before releasing the steam. Technically at this point, it’s done. But I recommend finishing with a quick browning session in the oven (see notes below).

Preheat oven to 320 degrees. Place all ingredients in a baking dish – it can be glass or ceramic (we use a round casserole dish – something between 8×8 and 9×13). Cover with foil and bake for 3-4 hours. If the gravy dries out, you can add a little water to the gravy to loosen it up before serving. See notes below for additional modifications/instructions.

Place everything in a slow cooker. Cook on low for 6-8 hours, or on high for 4 hours until tender and cooked through. Technically at this point, it’s done. But I recommend finishing with a quick browning session in the oven (see notes below).

Whether you make this in the oven or in the Instant Pot, I recommend finishing by giving it about 10-20 minutes in a hot oven (400-ish degrees), uncovered, before serving. It gets the meat nice and caramelized on top and helps the gravy thicken up.
